page.title: 01Llanfihangel to Capel Seion
page.content: A quiet rural, sparsely populated & mainly Welsh speaking area of small family farms. There are two distinct communities in the area, one in Llanfihangel which is a small contained village, the other the strip development along the main road from Pisgah to Capel Seion both with few facilities. Work outside farming is of a limited nature, consequently most people from the villages & hamlets work in Aberystwyth. There are 2 pubs, one or two one-man businesses and a gravel pit in the area. The scenery, flora & fauna are such that tourists are attracted to the area resulting in a few families offering bed & breakfast facilities for visitors. The social & cultural activities are many and varied, most of which centre round the chapels,church & village schools of Llanfihangel & nearby Capel Seion.
